record.title: DEVELOPMENT, RELIEF, AND EDUCATION FOR ALIEN MINORS ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED
record.narrative:
DEVELOPMENT, RELIEF, AND EDUCATION FOR ALIEN MINORS ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED -- (Senate - October 22, 2007)

[Page: S13202]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I was going to ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the consideration of S. 2205 at a time to be determined, but I am advised that there would be a Republican objection. Therefore, I will not ask that unanimous consent. In view of that objection that would have been lodged, I now move to proceed to Calendar No. 431, S. 2205, the DREAM Act, and I send a cloture motion to the desk.

record.chair: The cloture motion having been presented under rule XXII, the Chair directs the clerk to read the motion.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, do hereby move to bring to a close debate on the motion to proceed to Calendar No. 431, S. 2205, DREAM Act.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that the mandatory quorum be waived.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I withdraw the motion.
